column4: ok, stupid question: I have a flash drive containing a bootable Ubuntu partition, and I cannot figure out for the life of me how to erase this partition and restore the drive to a single 8GB FAT32 partition...I tried GParted, and it won't unmount the partition so I can't do anything with it, and if I eject it from Nautilus it ejects all parts of the drive so I can't modify it anymore.
Use another OS or a livecd to format it
I thought sometimes the alt gets captured by the screenshot taking thing? I dunno, I usually add it just to make sure
